title: The $90 Billion Squeeze: What the Triad's Budget Really Means for Your Capture Strategy
description: Two massive funding streams are converging as the Pentagon tears up its acquisition rulebook. The $40.5B Defense Health Program plus the new $50B Rural Health Transformation Program creates unprecedented opportunity—if you know where to look.

title: The MHS Triad Part 2: The Capability Stack
description: H2F is cutting injuries by 35% and suicides by 37%. The telehealth landscape is consolidating. Here's who's positioned to win—and what contractors need to know about enterprise RPM, the Oura disaster, and the Digital Front Door that died.

title: The MHS Triad Part 1: Meet the Three Leaders Who Will Reshape Military Medicine
description: Keith Bass. Emil Michael. Admiral Darin Via. Together, they're about to transform how we think about military medicine. The Department of War doctrine shift is real—and the audit mandate has teeth.

title: We're the Department of War Now
description: Executive Order 14347 isn't just optics. Defense.gov redirects to war.gov. The metric of success is no longer patient satisfaction—it's return-to-duty rates and survivability of the force.

title: The Audit Mandate: Why Everything Has to Work Now
description: DoD must achieve a clean audit opinion by December 31, 2028. Section 1002 gives this mandate real teeth: SES employees can be fired for audit failures. Here's what that means for MHS GENESIS and your programs.

title: The Oura Disaster: What Went Wrong and What Comes Next
description: The $96M sole-source contract didn't die because WHOOP filed a protest. It died because DHA realized it couldn't audit the data. The next wearables solicitation will require Audit-Ready Data Architecture.

title: Human Performance Optimization: Via's Doctrine Made Real
description: Admiral Via's 'Human Weapon System' isn't healthcare. It's cognitive enhancement, nutritional optimization, and sleep resilience. Here's what the Army's H2F program proves about ROI.

title: GenAI.mil: 3 Million Users, Right Now
description: Emil Michael launched GenAI.mil on December 9, putting Google's Gemini for Government on every DoD desktop. This isn't a pilot. AI is being embedded in the daily battle rhythm of every warfighter.
